intro: Linociera sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower linociera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often inconspicuous. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
